meanings.definition: Requiring considerable physical or mental effort.
meanings.sent1: The hike up the steep mountain was very effortful for the young children.
meanings.sent2: Studying for the difficult exam was an effortful task for the students.
meanings.sent3: It was quite effortful for the cat to catch the elusive mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her journey to recovery was an effortful climb up a steep and rocky mountain.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was so effortful that it took hours to complete.

meanings.sent1: The construction of the new building was an effortful project for the workers.
meanings.sent2: Cleaning the entire house was an effortful task that took all day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's effortful attempt to reach the bird feeder was in vain.
meanings.sent4: Her effortful decision to change careers led to a more fulfilling life.
meanings.sent5: The marathon was an effortful challenge that pushed the runners to their limits.
